history.content: Students can have their degrees conferred once. After that, their UC Berkeley Undergrad transcript is sealed. If you have not completed the minor at the time to you gradaute, you will not be able to. You would also have to take CS 170 through Concurrent Enrollment.

Hi, I'm currently a non-CS major senior in L&S, and I am currently unable to take CS170 due to schedule conflicts. However, I really would like to take this class at some point as I think it is a fundamental course for software engineers. The company I will be working would sponsor tuition, so I was considering taking the class at UC Berkeley in Fall 2019. Incidentally, this course would also allow me to fulfill all the requirements for the CS minor. Would this be possible / allowed after graduation? If not, what schools would be recommended for learning the same material? Thanks in advance -- this would greatly help in deciding where to learn the material covered in CS170!
history.subject: Minor Information
